job_details.Functieomschrijving:
The Privacy Engineering team is looking for a Fullstack Developer to deliver the next generation of our Privacy by Design process, which will focus on automating privacy compliance tasks.The Privacy Engineering function is part of the Product Trust team that works on addressing Privacy, Security, and OSS from the earliest stages of the product development lifecycle. As a member of this team, you will become the subject matter expert for privacy but can also expand into the license compliance and security domains. You will work with a global team to build infrastructure, automation tooling, drive improvement to compliance, and inform best practices for development teams., The privacy engineering team is looking to expand the team's skillset into full-stack development, with the goal of optimizing and automating the privacy compliance process with new tools:
     * Automation of privacy management : Design and develop tools and infrastructure to help privacy specialists, developers, product owners, product managers, account executives achieve privacy compliance. Design and develop tools to facilitate compliance verification and auditing.
     * Privacy by Design : Optimize how different stakeholders interface with the privacy by design process, . by automating manual tasks, in alignment with the broader Product Trust processes. Shape company-wide processes to integrate privacy by design principles and 'shift privacy left' in the product development lifecycle.
     * Privacy Scanners: develop privacy risk estimation scanner both analyzing data and code such as automatic detection of directly and indirectly identifiable information. Build infrastructure and tools to collect privacy-related metadata. Analyze metadata to produce insights for executives and decision makers.
     * Privacy Architecture and Privacy-aware Product Design: Support product designers and architect implementing privacy by design principles such as data minimization or implementing privacy enhancing techniques. Bridge team and compliance needs by defining appropriate privacy mitigations in collaboration with the Privacy Office.
job_details.full_text:
Fullstack Developer

The Privacy Engineering team is looking for a Fullstack Developer to deliver the next generation of our Privacy by Design process, which will focus on automating privacy compliance tasks.The Privacy Engineering function is part of the Product Trust team that works on addressing Privacy, Security, and OSS from the earliest stages of the product development lifecycle. As a member of this team, you will become the subject matter expert for privacy but can also expand into the license compliance and security domains. You will work with a global team to build infrastructure, automation tooling, drive improvement to compliance, and inform best practices for development teams., The privacy engineering team is looking to expand the team's skillset into full-stack development, with the goal of optimizing and automating the privacy compliance process with new tools:
     * Automation of privacy management : Design and develop tools and infrastructure to help privacy specialists, developers, product owners, product managers, account executives achieve privacy compliance. Design and develop tools to facilitate compliance verification and auditing.
     * Privacy by Design : Optimize how different stakeholders interface with the privacy by design process, . by automating manual tasks, in alignment with the broader Product Trust processes. Shape company-wide processes to integrate privacy by design principles and 'shift privacy left' in the product development lifecycle.
     * Privacy Scanners: develop privacy risk estimation scanner both analyzing data and code such as automatic detection of directly and indirectly identifiable information. Build infrastructure and tools to collect privacy-related metadata. Analyze metadata to produce insights for executives and decision makers.
     * Privacy Architecture and Privacy-aware Product Design: Support product designers and architect implementing privacy by design principles such as data minimization or implementing privacy enhancing techniques. Bridge team and compliance needs by defining appropriate privacy mitigations in collaboration with the Privacy Office.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on developing tools and infrastructure for privacy compliance automation, which involves software development and some data analysis related to privacy risks. However, it does not involve the core tasks of building, training, or fine-tuning predictive or generative AI models, nor does it heavily emphasize MLOps for AI systems. The role is more aligned with traditional software engineering applied to a specific domain (privacy) rather than a dedicated AI/ML engineering role. Therefore, it falls under the 'Ambiguous' category as it's primarily a software development role with a focus on compliance and automation, not a core AI/ML function.

job_tasks.justification: The role requires understanding the 'broader business context' of privacy compliance, aligning technical solutions with 'strategic goals' of privacy by design, and translating 'business needs' into technical requirements for privacy specialists, developers, and product managers.
job_tasks.phrase: deliver the next generation of our Privacy by Design process, which will focus on automating privacy compliance tasks

job_tasks.justification: The role involves understanding the 'broader business context' of privacy and security within the product development lifecycle and becoming a 'subject matter expert' in these domains.
job_tasks.phrase: The Privacy Engineering function is part of the Product Trust team that works on addressing Privacy, Security, and OSS from the earliest stages of the product development lifecycle.

job_tasks.justification: The role requires understanding the 'business needs' of various stakeholders (privacy specialists, developers, product owners, product managers, account executives) and aligning technical solutions to help them achieve privacy compliance.
job_tasks.phrase: Design and develop tools and infrastructure to help privacy specialists, developers, product owners, product managers, account executives achieve privacy compliance.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves understanding the 'business needs' related to privacy by design and optimizing how stakeholders interact with the process to align with broader Product Trust processes.
job_tasks.phrase: Optimize how different stakeholders interface with the privacy by design process, . by automating manual tasks, in alignment with the broader Product Trust processes.

job_tasks.justification: The role requires understanding the 'business needs' for privacy mitigations and collaborating with the Privacy Office to define them.
job_tasks.phrase: defining appropriate privacy mitigations in collaboration with the Privacy Office.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves building 'infrastructure and tools to collect privacy-related metadata' and analyzing this metadata, which are data engineering tasks.
job_tasks.phrase: Build infrastructure and tools to collect privacy-related metadata.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves analyzing 'data' as part of developing privacy risk estimation scanners.
job_tasks.phrase: privacy risk estimation scanner both analyzing data and code

job_tasks.justification: The role involves developing 'privacy risk estimation scanner' by analyzing data and code, which implies some form of model or rule-based system for detection, even if not explicitly AI/ML.
job_tasks.phrase: develop privacy risk estimation scanner both analyzing data and code such as automatic detection of directly and indirectly identifiable information.

job_tasks.justification: The role explicitly states 'Fullstack Developer' and involves 'Design and develop tools and infrastructure' to automate privacy compliance, which are core software development tasks.
The role involves 'Design and develop tools and infrastructure' to help various stakeholders achieve privacy compliance, which is a software development task.
job_tasks.phrase: Design and develop tools and infrastructure to help privacy specialists, developers, product owners, product managers, account executives achieve privacy compliance.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves 'Design and develop tools' to facilitate compliance verification and auditing, which are software development tasks.
job_tasks.phrase: Design and develop tools to facilitate compliance verification and auditing.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves 'automating manual tasks' within the privacy by design process, which requires software development.
job_tasks.phrase: automating manual tasks, in alignment with the broader Product Trust processes.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves developing 'privacy risk estimation scanner' by analyzing code, which is a software development task.
job_tasks.phrase: develop privacy risk estimation scanner both analyzing data and code such as automatic detection of directly and indirectly identifiable information.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves building 'infrastructure and tools' to collect privacy-related metadata, which is a software development task.
job_tasks.phrase: Build infrastructure and tools to collect privacy-related metadata.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves supporting product designers and architects in implementing privacy principles, which requires understanding and potentially developing software components.
job_tasks.phrase: Support product designers and architect implementing privacy by design principles such as data minimization or implementing privacy enhancing techniques.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves building 'infrastructure and automation tooling' to drive improvement to compliance and inform best practices, which can encompass aspects of operations engineering for the developed tools.
job_tasks.phrase: build infrastructure, automation tooling, drive improvement to compliance, and inform best practices for development teams.
